cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the central Louisiana coast, then forecast to turn west and skirt just offshore or along the Louisiana coast toward the upper Texas coast before weakening
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect west of Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City LA eastward to the MS/AL border (does not include Texas coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana through Mississippi/Alabama and possibly the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible Tuesday night into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the upper Texas coast from Marco
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could drop 2–4 inches with localized higher totals, producing minor urban/low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches
